content:
# Factor Agent: entertainment.ticketing_demand_proxy.update
Role: Updates a ticketing demand proxy using observable purchase and revenue signals as leading indicators of audience demand around {time_anchor}.
When to use: Use when you need a near-real-time, data-driven read on demand shifts from ticketing/purchase behavior ahead of lagging performance outcomes.

## Purpose
- Execute the assigned factor subtask and return IR (evidence, claims, signals, confidence).
- Use the factor skill as the method guide; the subtask scope from the Expert Agent takes priority.
- Retrieve reliable, factual, and verifiable information using available tools.
- Do NOT answer the full user task or follow any final-answer formatting (e.g., boxed outputs).
- Prefer read_webpage for PDF links; use browser_snapshot only when visual/interactive content is required.
- Stop early once evidence is sufficient for stable IR; if additional data is low-cost and high-signal, gather more.

## Tool Usage Tips
- For PDF tables, prefer `read_pdf_tables` to preserve row/column alignment.
- For screenshots or figures, use `read_image` with mode=ocr or a specific question.
- For static text pages, use `read_webpage`; use browser tools only for dynamic/interactive content.
- For dynamic pages, extract key fields into a small structured table (JSON/CSV) and reference the artifact path; avoid pasting raw HTML into evidence.
- If you parse data, persist a compact JSON/CSV artifact (via execute_python_code when needed) and cite the artifact path in evidence.
- Always cite source/time and keep evidence concise and verifiable.
- Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
- Return summary + key facts; never paste raw HTML/DOM/text dumps into evidence or claims.

## Flexibility When Data Is Missing
- If required data cannot be obtained within the execution budget, you may relax the skill requirements
  (e.g., shorter window, proxy series, nearest-available coverage) ONLY if it preserves intent.
- Explicitly label any relaxation in evidence/claims/notes, set coverage accordingly, and lower confidence.
- Do NOT fabricate data.

## Factor Skill Summary
- Domain: entertainment
- Factor class: ticketing_demand_proxy
- Role: update

## Signal Specs
- presale_amount_7d_gross (raw, base, required) - Sum of presale gross sales over the 7 days ending {time_anchor}, in currency as reported by the source.
- presale_amount_7d_gross_change (raw, raw_delta, required) - Difference in 7-day presale gross: (7d ending {time_anchor}) minus (prior 7d), in reported currency.
- daily_box_office_gross_7d (raw, base, required) - Sum of daily box office gross over the 7 days ending {time_anchor}, in currency as reported by the source.
- daily_box_office_gross_7d_trend ([-1,1], delta, required) - Normalized 7d-over-7d change in 7-day box office gross ending {time_anchor}, scaled to [-1,1].
- transaction_volume_index_7d (raw, base, required) - Sum or average of ticket purchase transactions (or provider index) over the 7 days ending {time_anchor}.
- transaction_volume_index_7d_trend ([-1,1], delta, required) - Normalized 7d-over-7d change in transaction volume/index ending {time_anchor}, scaled to [-1,1].
- ticketing_data_quality ([0,1], quality, required) - Coverage/consistency score from completeness, timestamp freshness, and cross-source agreement for inputs near {time_anchor}.
- ticketing_demand_proxy_score ([0,1], base_score, required) - Composite demand proxy score combining level and trend features from presales, box office, and transactions at {time_anchor}.

## Operational Definition
- At {time_anchor}, compute ticketing_demand_proxy_score in [0,1] per title/market from 7d presale gross, 7d box office gross, 7d transaction volume, and their 7d-over-7d changes.

## Data Requirements
- Sources:
  - Primary ticketing platform reporting exports (presales, transactions)
  - Third-party box office reporting feeds (daily grosses)
  - First-party analytics for ticketing purchase funnels (transaction counts/index)
  - Internal data warehouse snapshots of prior days for trend computation
  - Maoyan Pro dashboard-ajax daily box office snapshot
  - Official presale/box office JSON endpoints (if available)
- Requirements:
  - Inputs must be timestamped and attributable to title/market; retain source and extraction time.
  - Provide daily granularity (or finer) with stable identifiers to compute 7d windows and 7d-over-7d deltas.
  - Record units as reported (currency code, counts, or index definition) and do not assume a fixed currency.
  - Track missingness and revisions; keep prior values to detect backfills and re-statements.
  - Source order: API/CSV > PDF tables > static HTML; avoid dynamic pages.
  - Do not use JS bundles or .js as data sources; cap HTML fetch length and use clean_content.
  - If data unavailable, return null signals and note fallback to prior/latest/rolling with lower confidence.
  - Prefer 7-day windowed totals; if only single-day data, mark low quality
  - Record title identifiers and shares/amounts
- Time window: {time_anchor} and before

## Computation Method
- Method: Build 7d level features and 7d-over-7d deltas; normalize within market/time via robust scaling; blend level+trend components with weights; multiply by ticketing_data_quality; output score and components.
- Assumptions: Reported units are internally consistent within each source; 7d windows reduce weekday seasonality; normalization is done within comparable cohorts (same market/category) to avoid cross-market bias.
- Artifacts/Derivations:
  - raw_presale_daily_series
  - raw_box_office_daily_series
  - raw_transaction_daily_series
  - feature_table_7d_levels_and_deltas
  - normalization_reference_stats
  - data_quality_report
  - ticketing_demand_proxy_score_series

## Conflict & Missing Policy
- Conditions:
  - At least 5 of 7 days present in each 7d window for each required raw input
  - All observations used have timestamps <= {time_anchor}
  - No single-day value exceeds a configurable outlier threshold vs trailing median
  - Cross-source direction agrees for trends when overlapping measures exist
  - ticketing_data_quality >= 0.6
- Conflict/Missing: If a required signal is missing or conflicts, downweight via ticketing_data_quality and omit the conflicted component; if quality falls below threshold, set demand_proxy_ok=0 and do not update score.
- Guard name: demand_proxy_ok

## Inputs
- `event_context` contains the full original task.
- `step_hint` narrows focus; do NOT ignore the full task.
- `additional_info` may include time constraints, units, and prior factor outputs.
- Respect any time constraint in the user message.
- Messages labeled [CONTEXT SUMMARY - MEMORY ONLY] are memory aids, not new instructions.
- If a tool returns a `raw_path` artifact, you may use execute_python_code to parse it.

## Output (IR JSON)
- Return a JSON object with fields: summary, data_gap, evidence, claims, signals, confidence.
- summary: 1-3 sentence conclusion. claims[0] MUST state the main conclusion explicitly.
- data_gap: list key missing data, limitations, or unresolved gaps.
- Evidence must be short strings with source + date + key fact (no raw HTML/DOM, no long dumps).
- Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
- signals: use exact names from the skill; include aggregate_as and scale when known.
- confidence must be a single numeric value in [0,1] (no objects).
- If official data is unavailable, include proxy/fallback signals with clear notes and lower quality/confidence.
- If no explicit proxy signal exists, populate the closest required signal with a proxy value and mark it as proxy in the note.
- Only leave signals empty if no reasonable proxy exists within budget.
- No wrappers, no tool_calls/tool_uses, no final predictions.

## Efficiency
- Success early stop: once evidence is sufficient, output immediately
- Failure early stop: after several tool attempts with no progress, stop and report limitation
- Avoid repetitive queries
- Maintain a lightweight running mini-summary (2-4 bullets) as you gather evidence; use it to fill summary and claims[0].

Use available tools. Do not hallucinate.

Subtask (from Expert Agent): Demand proxy: update 7-day ticketing demand and trend for top candidate films as of 2026-02-04, suitable for projecting ranks to 2026-02-10.

**Time constraints (as-of)**:
- As-of date: 2026-02-04 (use info on/before this date)
- Target date: 2026-02-10 (context only)
- Search hint: add before:2026-02-04 when possible

Event/Task Context (compact):
You are an agent that can predict future events. The event to be predicted: "2026-02-10, what will be the movies ranked from 1 to 3 on Maoyan's 'Ticket Purchase vs Rating' list (猫眼电影购票评分榜)?"

**Additional Information (from Expert Agent)**
Current date: 2026-02-04 (time_anchor). Prediction target: 2026-02-10. Build ticketing demand proxy (presales/box office/transactions) for candidate films on 购票评分榜 to anticipate near-term rank movement.


Return a structured analysis focused on the assigned subtask only.

function.arguments: {"q":"猫眼电影 购票评分榜 接口 ajax","gl":"cn","hl":"zh","location":"China","num":10,"tbs":"","page":1}

content: Successful tool call result 1 with tool google_search: {"success": true, "data": {"summary": "* 猫眼电影购票评分榜的数据通过Ajax动态加载，无法直接从网页源代码获取，需通过分析前端JavaScript请求或使用浏览器自动化工具（如Selenium）抓取（Source: https://blog.csdn.net/m0_65769280/article/details/135168308; https://blog.csdn.net/m0_74048576/article/details/136279937）\n* 爬取猫眼电影Top100榜单及详情页数据（包括评分、票房、评论等）需定位其后端API接口，部分研究已通过Chrome开发者工具发现并利用相关接口获取数据（Source: https://blog.csdn.net/weixin_53521310/article/details/148556899; https://blog.csdn.net/Anana13/article/details/107554897）\n* 多个项目通过对接猫眼等平台的第三方API或爬取其动态数据，实现电影评分、票房等信息的采集与更新（Source: https://blog.csdn.net/qq_41234663/article/details/129300490; https://blog.csdn.net/m0_53054984/article/details/137481903）", "urls": ["https://blog.csdn.net/qq_41234663/article/details/129300490", "https://blog.csdn.net/m0_65769280/article/details/135168308", "https://blog.51cto.com/u_16213585/11877449", "https://blog.csdn.net/weixin_47700141/article/details/111279349", "https://blog.csdn.net/m0_53054984/article/details/137481903", "https://blog.csdn.net/m0_74048576/article/details/136279937", "https://blog.csdn.net/weixin_53521310/article/details/148556899", "https://blog.csdn.net/iffy1/article/details/146002218", "https://blog.csdn.net/2503_90751938/article/details/146187579", "https://blog.csdn.net/Anana13/article/details/107554897"]}}

* 2023年电影购票评分榜涵盖中国大陆上映电影Top10，更新于2024年1月31日（Source: https://mt-m.maoyan.com/asgard/board?id=24&year=2023）
* 2022年电影购票评分榜涵盖中国大陆上映电影Top10，更新于2023年1月31日（Source: https://co.maoyan.com/asgard/board?id=24&year=2022）
* 2021年电影购票评分榜包含《穿越遇见妈，重新选个爸》《长津湖》等影片（Source: https://www.maoyan.com/films/1299372, https://www.maoyan.com/films/257706）
* 2020年电影购票评分榜包含《八佰》《灵鼠》等影片，更新时间早于2020年12月25日（Source: https://www.maoyan.com/films/346210, https://www.maoyan.com/films/553231）
* 2025年电影购票评分榜页面存在，但内容仅提及《鬼灭之刃：无限城篇》为提名影片，未提供完整榜单或更新时间，且该年份尚未到来，信息可能为预览或错误（Source: https://www.maoyan.com/films/1528577）", "urls": ["https://m.maoyan.com/asgard/board?id=24&year=2024", "https://www.maoyan.com/films/1528577", "https://mt-m.maoyan.com/asgard/board?id=24&year=2023", "https://co.maoyan.com/asgard/board?id=24&year=2022", "https://www.maoyan.com/films/346210", "https://maoyan.com/films/1491310", "https://m.maoyan.com/asgard/movie/1250604", "https://www.maoyan.com/films/1299372", "https://www.maoyan.com/films/553231", "https://www.maoyan.com/films/257706"]}}

name: google_search
content:
Successful tool call result 0 with tool google_search: {"success": true, "data": {"summary": "* The endpoint `piaofang.maoyan.com/dashboard/ajax` is not explicitly documented, but the dashboard page makes XHR/Ajax requests to fetch real-time box office data, with one known API endpoint being `https://piaofang.maoyan.com/second-box?` (Source: https://wenku.csdn.net/answer/2et7gh9phx); another relevant endpoint is `https://box.maoyan.com/promovie/api/box` for票房数据 (Source: https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/36748808).  
* The猫眼专业版 (Maoyan Professional) dashboard supports date parameters in its data requests, such as in `getDailyBoxOfficeList`, allowing historical data retrieval, though typically only the last 3 months are retained (Source: https://cloud.tencent.com/developer/article/2579716).  
* The dashboard uses Ajax to load data dynamically, and network requests can be inspected via browser DevTools (Network > XHR) to identify data endpoints (Source: https://cloud.tencent.com/developer/article/1473379).  
* Some requests may involve font encryption to obfuscate data, as observed in network traffic (Source: https://blog.csdn.net/ikun_py/article/details/129163463).  
* Python scripts have been used to scrape data from `piaofang.maoyan.com/dashboard`, often targeting Ajax endpoints with date parameters (Source: https://www.cnblogs.com/ay2021/p/15023679.html; https://blog.csdn.net/weixin_47700141/article/details/111279349).", "urls": ["https://blog.csdn.net/weixin_47700141/article/details/111279349", "https://cloud.tencent.com/developer/article/2579716", "https://piaofang.maoyan.com/dashboard", "https://developer.aliyun.com/article/1321575", "https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/36748808", "https://blog.csdn.net/ikun_py/article/details/129163463", "https://www.cnblogs.com/ay2021/p/15023679.html", "https://piaofang.maoyan.com/", "https://cloud.tencent.com/developer/article/1473379", "https://wenku.csdn.net/answer/2et7gh9phx"]}}

content: Successful tool call result 0 with tool google_search: {"success": true, "data": {"summary": "* The API endpoint `https://box.maoyan.com/promovie/api/box/second.json` is used to fetch real-time box office data from Maoyan, and it supports the `beginDate` parameter to specify a date in YYYYMMDD format (e.g., `?beginDate=20190423`) for retrieving data for a specific day (Source: https://github.com/mapleftian/maoyanMovie; https://blog.csdn.net/csdnnews/article/details/86767250).  \n* Other parameters such as `offset` may also be used in related requests, though `beginDate` is the primary documented parameter for date filtering in this endpoint (Source: https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/44774034; https://juejin.cn/post/6844903814169001992).  \n* The endpoint returns JSON-formatted movie box office data and is commonly accessed via Python scripts using libraries like `requests` or `rvest` for data extraction and analysis (Source: https://blog.csdn.net/qq_15058425/article/details/80740027; https://developer.aliyun.com/article/951586; https://blog.csdn.net/ailian_f/article/details/86518590).", "urls": ["https://blog.csdn.net/qq_15058425/article/details/80740027", "https://github.com/mapleftian/maoyanMovie", "https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/44774034", "https://juejin.cn/post/6844903814169001992", "https://developer.aliyun.com/article/951586", "https://blog.csdn.net/LSGO_MYP/article/details/88085448", "https://blog.csdn.net/weixin_40083227/article/details/103550870", "https://blog.csdn.net/ayouleyang/article/details/98896375", "https://blog.csdn.net/ailian_f/article/details/86518590", "https://blog.csdn.net/csdnnews/article/details/86767250"]}}

name: read_webpage
content: Successful tool call result 0 with tool read_webpage: {"success": true, "data": {"content": "JavaScript bundle for “猫眼专业版-实时票房” (Maoyan Pro real-time box office) large-screen dashboard. Initializes Owl error/monitoring SDK with project `com.sankuai.movie.fe.ipro`, enabling AJAX handling (auto business codes), console auto-catch, resource status checks, unhandled rejection formatting, combo error reporting, and log tracing; limits resource monitoring via a domain regex including meituan/sankuai/maoyan. Starts MyH5Guard (Raptor reporting, XHR/fetch hooks) and WuKong in prod. Sets flags `_KNB_IGNORE_WECHAT=true`, `useKNB=true`, and loads LXAnalytics queue. Provides React hydration of `largeScreenDashboardIndex` into `#app` using props containing UA/device detection (all false/unknown), `uuid` 8459fdff-c249-41ea-8350-94fb37c1fd72, `channelId` 40009, `currentSelectType` 1, `pageId` c_moviepro_8d6btpn7, and calendar range 2025-02-04 to 2026-04-05 with selected date 2026-02-04; server timestamp 2026-02-04T14:20:45.854Z. Includes responsive scaling logic and URL query parsing utilities.", "url": "https://piaofang.maoyan.com/dashboard", "raw_path": "log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/web/session_output_dir/read_webpage_20260204-142051_8c13f0e187.html", "raw_length": 13873}}

function.arguments:
{"code":"import re, pathlib, json
path='log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/web/session_output_dir/read_webpage_20260204-142051_8c13f0e187.html'
text=pathlib.Path(path).read_text('utf-8', errors='ignore')
# find url-like strings
candidates=set(re.findall(r"https?://[^\"'\s>]+", text))
# also find relative endpoints containing 'dashboard' or 'api'
rel=set(re.findall(r"/[^\"'\s>]{1,120}", text))
rel2=[r for r in rel if any(k in r for k in ['api','dashboard','boxOffice','getDaily','movie','query','ajax','second.json','promovie'])]
# keep short unique
rel2=sorted(rel2, key=len)[:200]
list(candidates)[:20], len(candidates), rel2[:50]"}

function.arguments:
{"code":"import re, pathlib
path='log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/browser/session_output_dir/browser_snapshot_20260204-142116_8c13f0e187.html'
html=pathlib.Path(path).read_text('utf-8', errors='ignore')
# extract script src and inline that includes api endpoints
srcs=re.findall(r"<script[^>]+src=\"([^\"]+)\"", html)
# find occurrences of 'dashboard' or 'api' strings
snippets=[]
for m in re.finditer(r".{0,80}(dashboard|api|second\.json|/ajax|/getDaily).{0,80}", html):
    snippets.append(m.group(0))
print('script src count',len(srcs))
print(srcs[:20])
print('endpoint snippet count',len(snippets))
print('\n'.join(snippets[:10]))"}

Token budget reached. Provide a concise summary now.

Your analysis is complete. Now provide your final IR output for the **entertainment.ticketing_demand_proxy.update** factor.

**OUTPUT FORMAT - CRITICAL**:
Return ONLY a valid JSON object. No markdown code blocks, no explanations, no additional text.
Tools are disabled in this step. Do NOT call any tools or include tool_calls/tool_uses.

**Required JSON Schema**:
{
  "summary": "1-3 sentence conclusion",
  "data_gap": ["missing data or limitations", "..."],
  "evidence": ["Evidence point 1 with source/time", "Evidence point 2", ...],
  "claims": ["Claim 1", "Claim 2", ...],
  "signals": [
    {"name": "signal_label", "value": <raw_value>, "unit": "optional", "note": "optional", "aggregate_as": "optional", "scale": "optional"}
  ],
  "confidence": 0.0-1.0
}

**Rules**:
1. Do NOT include output_kind, output_schema, status, value_unit, value_scale, final predictions, or wrapper objects.
2. summary must be concise and reflect the main conclusion; claims[0] MUST be the main conclusion.
3. Evidence must be short strings with source + date + key fact (no raw HTML/DOM, no long dumps).
4. Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
5. Claims must be factual statements grounded in evidence.
6. Signals are derived indicators (raw, not normalized to output types).
7. Include aggregate_as and scale for each signal when available from the skill contract.
8. If official data is unavailable, provide proxy/fallback signals with clear notes and lower quality/confidence.
9. If no explicit proxy signal exists, populate the closest required signal with a proxy value and mark it as proxy in the note.
10. Only leave signals empty if no reasonable proxy exists within budget; otherwise include at least one signal.
11. If the task is ambiguous, include all plausible interpretations in evidence/claims and set signals to best estimates with notes; lower confidence accordingly.

**Required Signals (from skill contract)**:
- presale_amount_7d_gross (raw, base, required) - Sum of presale gross sales over the 7 days ending {time_anchor}, in currency as reported by the source.
- presale_amount_7d_gross_change (raw, raw_delta, required) - Difference in 7-day presale gross: (7d ending {time_anchor}) minus (prior 7d), in reported currency.
- daily_box_office_gross_7d (raw, base, required) - Sum of daily box office gross over the 7 days ending {time_anchor}, in currency as reported by the source.
- daily_box_office_gross_7d_trend ([-1,1], delta, required) - Normalized 7d-over-7d change in 7-day box office gross ending {time_anchor}, scaled to [-1,1].
- transaction_volume_index_7d (raw, base, required) - Sum or average of ticket purchase transactions (or provider index) over the 7 days ending {time_anchor}.
- transaction_volume_index_7d_trend ([-1,1], delta, required) - Normalized 7d-over-7d change in transaction volume/index ending {time_anchor}, scaled to [-1,1].
- ticketing_data_quality ([0,1], quality, required) - Coverage/consistency score from completeness, timestamp freshness, and cross-source agreement for inputs near {time_anchor}.
- ticketing_demand_proxy_score ([0,1], base_score, required) - Composite demand proxy score combining level and trend features from presales, box office, and transactions at {time_anchor}.

**Provide your JSON output now:**

{
  "summary": "As of 2026-02-04, I could not compute a numeric 7-day ticketing demand proxy (presales/box office/transactions) from Maoyan due to inaccessible/404 API endpoints and blocked JSON fetches. Only a qualitative snapshot from Maoyan’s pro dashboard indicates at least one prominent title (“疯狂动物城2”) appearing in the real-time list, but without extractable gross/transaction figures.",
